definition: to advance prematurely
surname Mao
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: They queered their Three-Year Plan by their premature advance.
sentences.chinese: 他們的盲目冒進使三年計劃搞得一團糟。

sentences.english: But there are big risks, too, in aggressively pushing change.
sentences.chinese: 當然如果冒進推動這種變革，同時存在很大風險。

sentences.english: People would be wise to abandon rash inclinations and instead try in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 人們摒棄急燥冒進並代之以嚴肅認識是明智之舉。

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
ill-gotten wealth or gains
to capitulate
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
magnanimous
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
misconception/fallacy
conclusion/judgment/verdict
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
scoundrel/rogue/bully/villain
